{{Infobox concert tour | image = The Great Escape Tour.jpg | image_caption = Promotional poster for the tour | image_size = 220px | border = yes | artist = [[Iggy Azalea]] | album = {{unbulleted list|''[[The New Classic]]''|''[[Reclassified]]''}} | start_date = {{start date|2015|09|18|df=yes}} | end_date = {{end date|2015|10|27|df=yes}} | number_of_legs = 1 | number_of_shows = * 21 in [[North America]] * 21 in total | last_tour = [[The New Classic Tour]]
(2014) | this_tour = '''Great Escape Tour'''
(2015; cancelled) | next_tour = Bad Girls Tour
(2018; cancelled) }} The '''Great Escape Tour''' was the scheduled second headlining concert tour by Australian recording artist [[Iggy Azalea]] in support of her debut album, ''[[The New Classic]]'' (2014), its reissue, ''[[Reclassified]]'' (2014) and then-upcoming second studio album. The tour was scheduled to visit twenty-one cities across [[North America]] over the span of two months, beginning on 18 September 2015 in [[San Diego, California]] and concluding on 27 October 2015 in [[Glendale, Arizona]]. It was announced on 29 May 2015 that the entire tour was cancelled, with a new tour to be announced with her then-upcoming, later cancelled album in 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2015/05/iggy-azalea-cancels-tour/|title=Iggy Azalea Cancels Her Tour|work=[[XXL (magazine)|XXL]]|date=29 May 2015|accessdate=29 May 2015}} It was the first of Azalea's tours to be cancelled, with her 2018 Bad Girls Tour also later cancelled.{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/iggy-azalea-bad-girls-tour-canceled-1150078|title=Iggy Azalea Bad Girls Tour Canceled|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|last=Jaime|first=Natalya|date=7 October 2018|accessdate=8 October 2018}} ==Background== On 10 December 2014, when reflecting on the year she has had and the struggles she faced in the years before, Azalea announced plans of an arena tour and a second studio album via her [[Twitter]] account. The same day, Azalea revealed the title of the tour and the concept behind it, which is Azalea picturing herself as "a musical escape artist for people." Azalea also revealed that the name of the tour goes along with the title of her upcoming second studio album, which will also be promoted on the tour.{{cite web|last=Bobb|first=Maurice|title=Iggy Azalea's Planning Her 'Great Escape': Here's What She's Talking About|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2023011/iggy-azalea-announces-great-escape-tour/|work=[[MTV]]|date=10 December 2014|accessdate=23 January 2015}} On 15 December 2014, the North American leg of the tour was officially announced. Presented by [[Anschutz Entertainment Group|AEG]], the first leg of tour, which was set to commence on 14 April 2015 in [[Fresno, California]], and was scheduled to visit twenty-four cities across North America during the spring of 2015 before ending on 24 May 2015 in [[Austin, Texas]]. Also revealed in the North American leg announcement was that [[Nick Jonas]] and [[Tinashe]] would be the special guests supporting Azalea on the first leg of the tour promoting their latest individual efforts, ''[[Nick Jonas (album)|Nick Jonas]]'' (2014) and ''[[Aquarius (Tinashe album)|Aquarius]]'' (2014). Azalea's [[disc jockey]], DJ Wizz Kidd, would also support Azalea throughout the tour.{{cite web|last=Bobb|first=Maurice|title=Iggy Azalea Announces The Great Escape Tour Dates: See Them Here!|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2027204/iggy-azalea-great-escape-tour-nick-jonas/|work=[[MTV]]|date=15 December 2014|accessdate=23 January 2015}} Beginning on 15 December 2014, pre-sale tickets were available to all [[American Express]] cardholders through 18 December 2014. The public on-sale followed immediately after with tickets becoming available on 19 December 2014. Platinum and VIP Packages also became available for purchase on AEG's website, in which the packages included premium seating and exclusive autographed merchandise.{{cite web|title=Iggy Azalea Blazes a Trail For the Can’t-Miss The Great Escape Tour|url=http://www.aeglive.com/news/view/12284|work=[[Anschutz Entertainment Group]]|date=15 December 2014|accessdate=23 January 2015}} In an interview with ''[[GQ]]'', Azalea began to reveal details about the tour's stage, visuals, and concept. When speaking about her main focus of the tour, Azalea stated "I want everything to be right—everything, from the tour book to what someone wears. Even the right faces for the dancers, and their attitude. Everything is equally important." While discussing stage layout, Azalea revealed that she's "trying to work on the initial stage design" and that she's "making a stage that [she can] engage with many people in an arena that big." She also noted that she was working with [[Jamie King]], who has also worked with [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] on her [[Confessions Tour]] (2006), which Azalea has stated is a major influence for the tour. Other influences for the tour that she's mentioned include the films ''[[Xanadu (film)|Xanadu]]'' (1980) and ''[[Fantasia (1940 film)|Fantasia]]'' (1940). In regards to the visuals, Azalea has stated that the tour will include "color blocking—loud, just obnoxious-type visual things", that she also characterized as "Trippy, cool, [and] colorful." Azalea also commented on the nature of the show by saying "The traditional hip-hop arena show is more focused on a DJ. I don't think it has as many props and spectacles as perhaps a pop show, which is also what I would say my show is visually like." Overall, Azalea has stated her desire for the show is "not to be too wacky" and to be "a great experience [in which fans feel] really immersed in the whole thing."{{cite web|last=Ball|first=Sarah|title=Iggy Azalea Hopes She'll Still Be "Gyrating in a Leotard at 35"|url=https://www.gq.com/entertainment/music/201502/iggy-azalea-interview-grammys|work=[[GQ]]|date=20 January 2015|accessdate=23 January 2015}} "The whole point was to make no compromises, but nothing's changed in terms of my creative vision," Azalea told the [[Associated Press]] on 18 March 2014, backstage at a show for [[Samsung Galaxy]] during [[South by Southwest|SXSW]]. "It's very kind of like [[Patrick Nagel]], powerful 80s androgynous women vibe." Azalea admitted not wanting to wait until September to launch the tour, "but because the arenas are so far in advanced booked, it was kind of their next slot." She also mentioned taking advantage of the free time to finish recording her second album, "I didn't anticipate having any time to completely finish it, but now that I have kind of the time, I'd love to have an album at the end of 2015."{{cite web|title=Interview: Iggy Azalea Talks 'Trouble,' Tour Postponement & More with Michelle and Booker|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/iggy-azalea-social-media-tour-album-britney-spears-29746908|website=abcnews.go.com|date=19 March 2015|accessdate=19 March 2015}} On 29 March 2015, Azalea told ''Billboard'' at the [[iHeartRadio Music Awards]], the tour was now under the creative guidance of a new production designer, Baz Halpin, who'd been seasoning the show with a post-apocalyptic vibe, "It's going to be maybe a bit like [[Blade Runner]], full of dark and '80s ridiculous fare but not in a cliché way," also revealing she had parted ways with former tour producer AEG Live over creative differences earlier that month. "It's been great working with a new person who really understands my vision," Azalea said of Halpin, who had also fashioned the set for her performance of "[[Trouble (Iggy Azalea song)|Trouble]]" with [[Jennifer Hudson]] both at the iHeartRadio Awards and [[Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards]] on the previous day. "It's taken some of the workload off me that he's able to understand what I'm trying to achieve instead of battling it, or it being lost in translation," Azalea continued. "Some things just work. With Baz, I really don't have to say it; he's thinking what I'm thinking, and it's great. I'm super-excited about the tour," she said.{{cite web|title=Iggy Azalea Is Done 'Battling' for What She Wants on Tour|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6516964/iggy-azalea-tour-iheartradio-awards-interview|work=Billboard|date=30 March 2015|accessdate=31 March 2015}} ==Rescheduling and cancellation== On 10 March 2015, it was announced the tour was being rescheduled "due to tour production delays", according to a statement from Def Jam Recordings. After reports surfaced that the tour was to be cancelled due to lack of promotion and conflict between her and management, Def Jam announced the decision "to accommodate for creative team availability and tour productions, it was determined that the tour will not be ready this spring." They continued, "It's important to Iggy that she delivers the show she envisaged to share with her fans and that requires more time in development." The spring tour was rescheduled to the fall, kicking off on September 18 in San Diego, California. A rep for Azalea also added that "there's no truth to the rumor that there's any conflict between her and her management." The press release issued by AEG Live also noted tickets for dates on the tour would be valid for the new dates in the fall, with the exception of the Baltimore, Las Vegas and Sacramento shows being canceled altogether, also indicating that the opening acts for the spring tour, Nick Jonas and Tinashe, would be replaced.{{cite web|last=Varga|first=George|title=Iggy Azalea postpones her spring tour to fall|url=http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2015/mar/10/iggy-azalea-reschedules-spring-tour-for-fall/|website=utsandiego.com|date=10 March 2015|accessdate=10 March 2015}} Shortly after the announcement, a message was also posted from Azalea's official Twitter account: "The tour getting pushed back only means that it'll be way more amazing than it would've been in April. Good things take time."{{cite web|last=Boardman|first=Madeline|title=Iggy Azalea Postpones The Great Escape Tour, Pushes It Months Back|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/iggy-azalea-postpones-the-great-escape-tour-pushes-it-months-back-2015103|work=[[Us Weekly]]|date=10 March 2015|accessdate=10 March 2015}} On 29 May 2015, it was announced that the entire tour had been cancelled, with ticket holders receiving an email that stated "The Iggy Azalea Great Escape Tour scheduled for this fall has been cancelled and refunds are available at point of purchase. There will be a new tour planned around Iggy's new record to be released in 2016 and we apologize for any inconvenience." Azalea stated, "I'm sad and sorry to let my fans down," confirming plans to "be back on the road when the next album is done."{{cite web|title=Iggy Azalea apologises to fans for cancelling tour|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/32943518/iggy-azalea-apologises-to-fans-for-cancelling-tour|work=bbc.co.uk|date=29 May 2015|accessdate=1 June 2015}} She later issued a statement clarifying the cancellation saying she "had a different creative change of heart," in addition to being unable to find new opening acts available for the new dates she thought that would be a good fit for the tour and announcing she would also be taking a break to figure out the progression she wanted for her sound and visuals.{{cite web|last=Rizzo|first=Monica|title=Iggy Azalea Reveals Why She Canceled Her Upcoming Tour|url=http://www.seventeen.com/celebrity/music/news/a31241/exclusive-iggy-azalea-on-why-she-canceled-her-upcoming-tour/|work=[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]|date=1 June 2015|accessdate=1 June 2015}} The tour promoter, AEG Live's senior VP Debra Rathwell, stated they never put its full marketing support behind the tour, explaining, "As we were not able to fill the support slots on the tour in the fall, due to so many artists already having commitments and working this summer, we had not advertised or promoted the new shows since last winter." She added, "The dates were selling well and were going to do fine,” standing by Azalea’s creative decision to take a break and not exploring a move to smaller venues by clarifying, "there was no reason to do so. AEG LIVE is committed to her and will be working with her on her new tour." Azalea’s booking agency, CAA, also issued a statement, "The lines of communication between Iggy, myself, and her [Turn First] managers Sarah [Stennett] and Nadia [Khan] have always been open. Iggy is an incredibly talented and creative artist with a clear vision, which she continuously shares with myself and her management team."{{cite web|last=Boardman|first=Madeline|title=Iggy Azalea Tour Cancellation Explained by AEG's Debra Rathwell & CAA's Cara Lewis: Exclusive|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/business/6590031/iggy-azalea-tour-cancellation-aeg-caa-explanation|work=Billboard|date=4 June 2015|accessdate=5 June 2015}} ==Commercial performance== After the tickets for the tour became available to the public for purchase on 19 December 2014, ''[[Forbes]]'' reported positive news for ticket sales on the primary and secondary markets. On 7 January 2015, a list compiled by [[TiqIQ]] revealed that tickets for Azalea's tour were ranked fourteenth for most expensive concert tickets of the year as of that month. On the secondary market, the average ticket price for Azalea's tour totals in about $167, therefore making the tickets some of the most expensive tickets available on the secondary market. Ticket prices for the tour managed to top artists such as the [[Foo Fighters]], but paled in comparison to artists such as [[Fleetwood Mac]], [[Maroon 5]], and [[Taylor Swift]].{{cite web|last=Lawrence|first=Jesse|title=Top 15 2015 Concert Tours at the Ticket '''Katie Martin''' (born '''Katie Louise Van Veen''' on January 8, 1972) is an American [[consultant]] in [[Environmentally friendly|eco-friendly]] special events, [[floral design]], and green events and life styles.
== Personal life == {{unreferenced|date=July 2018|section}} Martin was born in [[Washington, DC]]. She graduated from the [[University of Maryland, College Park]], in 1994 with a BS in [[accounting]]. She has one son and is married to Neftali Miguel Vasquez Perez.
== Features and interviews == * [[Style Network]]'s show ''[[Whose Wedding Is It Anyway]]?''<ref>[http://video.tvguide.com/ID/544864 ''TV Guide.'' Whose Wedding Is It Anyway?]</ref> * [[Washingtonian magazine|''Washingtonian'' magazine]]<ref>[http://www.washingtonian.com/chats/shopping/10456.html Washingtonian.com: Wedding Planner Chat with Katie Martin]</ref> * ''[[Washington Post]]''<ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2005/06/22/AR2005062201475.html ''Washington Post''. "Down the Aisle, Into the Melting Pot."]</ref> *''Elegant Bride'' magazine<ref>[http://www.brides.com/planning/flowers/feature/article/6399#top Brides.com. Expert design.]</ref> *''Floral Management'' magazine<ref>[http://www.eleganceandsimplicity.com/press.htm ''Floral Management''. "The Chosen One." (Select #48)]</ref> *[[WUSA (TV)|WUSA]] (Washington, DC, CBS affiliate)<ref>[http://www.wusa9.com/news/news_article.aspx?storyid=33016 WUSA. Local Couple Prepares for 9/11 Wedding.]</ref> *[[WTOP-FM|WTOP]] (Washington, DC, talk-radio station)<ref>[http://www.eleganceandsimplicity.com/images/press/09-10%20a%20720%20Sept%2011th%20Wedding.mp3 WTOP]</ref> *[[TBD TV]] (Washington, DC, cable television network)<ref>http://www.letstalklive.tv/n_videoplayer.cfm?video=ltlmartin0129.wmv&id=105</ref>
Martin’s work also has been showcased in ''DC Modern Luxury Magazine'', ''Flower Magazine'', ''Catering Magazine'', ''Florists' Review'', ''Washington Woman'', ''Grace Ormonde'', ''Upscale Magazine'', ''Bride & Bloom'', ''Modern Bride'', ''My Day Magazine'', ''The Knot'', ''Engaged Magazine'', and ''La Bella Bride''.
Founded in 1998, Martin's wedding and event planning company, Elegance & Simplicity Wedding & Event Designers, Inc. (located in [[Bethesda, Maryland]] with a sister office in [[Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic]]) has planned about 3,500 [[wedding]]s worldwide.<ref name="washingtonian.com">[http://www.washingtonian.com/blogarticles/weddings/bridalparty/10469.html Washingtonian.com. Bridal Party Chat: Ask an Ecofriendly Planner]</ref> Martin also founded and runs Green Life DC, a consulting firm that helps individuals, families, events and businesses be more environmentally friendly.
Currently Martin is writing a book on [[green wedding]]s.<ref name="washingtonian.com"/>

The first recorded use in English of the word ''massacre'' in the name of an event is due to [[Christopher Marlow]] who in c. 1600 referred to what is now known as the [[St. Bartholomew's Day massacre]] as "The massacre at Paris""Marlowe (c. 1600) (''title'') The massacre at Paris". [[Oxford English Dictionary]] Massacre, n. The purpose of the list is to trace such of the term "massacre" specifically. There are many alternative terms with similar connotations, such as [[:wikt:butchery|butchery]], [[:wikt:carnage|carnage]], [[:wikt:bloodbath|bloodbath]], [[:wikt:mass killing|mass killing]], [[wikt:atrocity|atrocity]], etc. as well as euphemisms such as ''[[Sicilian Vespers|Vespers]]'', ''[[Blutgericht]]'' or "attack", "incident", "tragedy" (etc.), use of which are outside the scope of this list. It was the worst shooting massacre by a lone perpetrator in modern U.S. history, until the [[2017 Las Vegas shooting]].{{cite news|title=Orlando Sees Worst Mass Shooting On U.S. Soil: What We Know Monday|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/06/13/481835963/worst-mass-shooting-on-u-s-soil-what-we-know-monday|work=NPR.org}} |} ==See also== *[[:Category:Massacres]] ** [[:Category:Lists of massacres by country]] * [[Genocides in history]] * [[List of battles and other violent events by death toll]] * [[List of events named pogrom]] * [[List of genocides by death toll]] * [[List of massacres at sea]] * [[List of massacres in the United States]] * [[List of terrorist incidents]] ** [[List of mass car bombings]] * [[Crimes against humanity]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Massacres by period}} {{Refbegin}} *{{cite book |last=Mikaberidze|first=Alexander|chapter=Chronology of massacres and war crimes |title=Atrocities, Massacres, and War Crimes: An Encyclopedia|year=2013|publisher=ABC-CLIO|isbn=978-1-59884-926-4|pages=773–766 |ref=harv}} * World History Database, ''[http://worldhistory.org.uk/battles/ Alphabetic Listing of Battles]'' Index of World battles. * Radford, Robert, ''[http://www.imperialtometric.com/Edition/greatbattles.html Great Historical Battles]''. The following is a list of historically famous prison escapes, and of multiple prison escapes:
==Famous historical escapes== [[File:Famous adventures and prison escapes of the civil war (1893) (14573020789).jpg|{{largethumb}}|On November 27, 1863, [[John Hunt Morgan]] and six of his officers, most notably [[Thomas Hines]], escaped from their cells in the [[Ohio Penitentiary]] by digging a tunnel from Hines' cell into the inner yard and then ascending a wall with a rope made from bunk coverlets and a bent poker iron.]]
There have been many infamous escapes throughout history:
===13th century=== * In 1244, whilst imprisoned in the [[Tower of London]], [[Gruffydd ap Llywelyn Fawr]] crafted a make-shift rope made of bed sheets and cloths, lowered it, and climbed down. However, because he was heavy, the rope broke and as a consequence, he fell to his death.<ref>https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=8QY7AAAAQBAJ&pg=PT135&dq=gruffydd+ap+llywelyn+fawr+death+rope&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi2i-Gvif7XAhVE-qQKHbfaD2sQ6AEINzAC#v=onepage&q=gruffydd%20ap%20llywelyn%20fawr%20death%20rope&f=false</ref>
===17th century=== * In 1621 Dutch author [[Hugo Grotius]] escaped from [[Loevestein|Loevestein Castle]] where he was held captive by hiding himself inside a book chest. He was then smuggled outside.
===18th century===
* Englishman [[Jack Sheppard]] took to theft and burglary in 1723, and was arrested and imprisoned five times in 1724 but escaped four times, making him a notorious public figure and wildly popular with the poorer classes. * The Italian author and adventurer [[Giacomo Casanova]] escaped from prison in 1757.
===19th century=== *In the [[Libby Prison Escape]], during the [[American Civil War]], over 109 [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] [[POWs]] broke out of a building at [[Libby Prison]] in [[Richmond, Virginia]] on the night between February 9 and February 10, 1864. All but 50 (two were drowned in the nearby [[James River (Virginia)|James River]]) successfully reached back to Union lines. *The notorious outlaw [[Billy The Kid]] managed to escape from prison in 1881, but was captured and shot by [[Pat Garrett]] only a few months later.
===1900–1950=== * In 1901, [[Lum You]] was convicted of murder and sentenced to death by a [[Pacific County, Washington]] court. He enjoyed great public sympathy, including from county officials, who supposedly allowed him to escape by leaving his cell door unlocked at night. He eventually seized the opportunity, but within a few days he either gave himself up or was recaptured.<ref name="stevens">{{cite news|first=Sydney |last=Stevens |title=Behind Bars in Old Pacific County, 1902: The Hanging of Lum You |newspaper=Chinook Observer |date=June 7, 2011 |url=http://www.chinookobserver.com/news/history/the-hanging-of-lum-you/article_303b3b2a-912f-11e0-a1e7-001cc4c002e0.html |accessdate=August 18, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130503121544/http://www.chinookobserver.com/news/history/the-hanging-of-lum-you/article_303b3b2a-912f-11e0-a1e7-001cc4c002e0.html |archivedate=May 3, 2013 |df= }}</ref><ref name="espy">{{cite book | first=Willard R. | last=Espy | authorlink=Willard R. Espy | title=Oysterville: Roads to Grandpa's Village |year=1976 |publisher=University of Washington Press |isbn=0-517-52196-2 |pages=142–143}}</ref> * German Naval Air Service Kapitänleutnant [[Gunther Plüschow]] escaped from the [[Donington Hall]] [[prisoner of war camp]] in 1915. * [[Frederick Mors]], an Austrian-born American serial killer, was declared insane and placed into the Matteawan Institution for the Insane in the United States in 1915. He escaped in 1916 and was never seen again. *Leonard T. Fristoe was imprisoned for double murder in 1920 of a police Constable and a deputy Sherriff in Nevada.<ref>[https://www.odmp.org/officer/17466-constable-arthur-j-st-clair ODMP memorial]</ref> He escaped from Nevada State Prison in 1923. He lived for nearly 46 years under the allias of Claude R. Willis, before being turned in by his own son.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/records-11000/longest-prison-escape/ |title=Longest prison escape |publisher=Guinnessworldrecords.com |date= |accessdate=2014-05-15}}</ref> After serving several years in prison he died of natural causes . * [[John Dillinger]] served time at the Indiana State Penitentiary at Michigan City, until 1933, when he was paroled. Within four months, he was back in jail in [[Lima, Ohio]], but his gang sprang him, killing the jailer, Sheriff Jessie Sarber. Most of the gang was captured again by the end of the year in [[Tucson, Arizona]], due to a fire at the Historic Hotel Congress. Dillinger alone was sent to the Lake County jail in [[Crown Point, Indiana]]. He was to face trial for the suspected killing of police officer William O'Malley during a bank shootout in [[East Chicago, Indiana]], some time after his escape from jail. During this time on trial, a famous photograph was taken of Dillinger putting his arm on prosecutor Robert Estill's shoulder when suggested to him by reporters. * On March 3, 1934, Dillinger escaped from the "escape-proof" (as it was dubbed by local authorities at the time) Crown Point, Indiana county jail, which was guarded by many police officers and national guardsmen. Newspapers reported that Dillinger had escaped using a fake gun made from wood, blackened and shined with shoe polish. * French prisoner [[René Belbenoît]] escaped from the penal colony of French Guiana on March 2, 1935 when he and five others took to the sea with a boat they had bought. After a series of daring adventures, during which all of the other escapees were captured, he reached United States in 1937. In 1938 his account, ''Dry Guillotine'', was published. Belbenoît had written it in French and it was translated in English by Preston Rambo. It went through 14 printings in less than a year. * Japanese murderer [[Yoshie Shiratori]] broke out of prison four times between the 1930s and 1940s. A novel and TV-drama ''Hagoku'' was based on his true story. * [[Fort San Cristóbal (Spain)|Fort San Cristóbal]] is located on the top of the mountain San Cristóbal, which is very close (4 km) to [[Pamplona]], [[Spain]]. Built inside the mountain and obsolete since its opening in 1919, due to its weakness against aviation, it served as a prison. On May 22, 1938, during the [[Spanish Civil War]], around 30 prisoners organised a mutiny for a massive prison break. 792 prisoners fled but only three succeeded in getting to the [[France|French]] border; 585 were arrested, 211 died and 14 of the arrested who were considered the leaders were sentenced to death. Most fugitives were intercepted during the following days. In 1988, a sculpture was erected to honour the memory of the Republican people dead there. The fort ceased to be a prison in 1945. * [[Colditz Castle]] was used as an "escape-proof" prisoner-of-war camp during [[World War II]], but over the course of 300 escape attempts, 130 prisoners escaped.{{Citation needed|date=December 2007}} Thirty escapees eventually managed to reach friendly territory. The men had tunneled, disguised themselves as guards, workmen or women, sneaked away through sewer drains, and even planned to use a glider to get over the wall. * [[André Devigny]], a French resistance fighter during World War II, escaped [[Fort Montluc|Montluc Military Prison]] in Lyons with his cellmate in April 1943. * French author [[Henri Charrière]] tried to escape in vain several times, but eventually was successful in 1943. His story, ''[[Papillon (book)|Papillon]]'', was published and filmed [[Papillon (1973 film)|under the same name]]. * In [[Stalag Luft III|the Great Escape]], 76 Allied POWs (primarily Commonwealth airmen) escaped from [[Stalag Luft III]] during World War II. 73 of the escapees were captured and fifty of them were executed by the [[Gestapo]], while only three succeeded in reaching neutral territories. *In the [[Cowra breakout]], at least 545 out of approximately 1000 Japanese POWs escaped from Number 12 POW Compound at Cowra on the night of 4 August 1944. Out of the roughly 500 escapees, 231 died and 108 were wounded. 31 killed themselves and 12 were burnt to death in huts set on fire by the Japanese. Sixteen of the wounded showed signs of attempted suicide.<ref name="memorial">{{cite book|last=Long|first=Gavin|year=1963|chapter-url=https://www.awm.gov.au/images/collection/pdf/RCDIG1070308--1-.pdf|url=https://www.awm.gov.au/collection/RCDIG1070206/|title=The Final Campaigns|chapter=Appendix 5 – The Prison Break at Cowra, August 1944|series=Australia in the War of 1939–1945. Series 1 – Army|volume=Volume 7|location=Canberra|publisher=Australian War Memorial|oclc=1297619|pp=623–624}}</ref> *In the [[Great Papago Escape]], over 25 German POWs escaped by tunneling out of [[Camp Papago Park|Camp Papago Park POW facility]], near [[Phoenix, Arizona]], on the night of December 23, 1944. They then fled into the surrounding desert but because the rivers in Arizona were mostly dry and had not been navigable for decades, most of them were recaptured without bloodshed over the next few weeks. *In the [[Acre Prison break]], 28 members of the Jewish underground groups [[Irgun]] and [[Lehi (group)|Lehi]] escaped from [[Acre Prison]] in [[Acre, Israel|Acre]], [[Mandatory Palestine]] (now [[Israel]]) on May 4, 1947.
===1950–1975=== *In 1959, [[Frank Freshwaters]] escaped from an Ohio prison while serving a sentence of involuntary manslaughter from a 1957 car accident. After 56 years he was arrested in Florida.<ref>[http://www.ibtimes.com/shawshank-redemption-real-frank-freshwater-captured-after-56-years-run-fugitive-1910767 IB Tribune]</ref> *In the [[June 1962 Alcatraz escape|Alcatraz escape on June 11, 1962]], American criminals brothers [[June 1962 Alcatraz escape#John and Clarence Anglin|John and Clarence Anglin]], and [[Frank Morris (prisoner)|Frank Morris]] escaped [[Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary]] on [[Alcatraz Island]] using an inflatable raft, never to be seen again. It was never determined by the [[FBI]] whether they succeeded in their escape or died in the attempt. *In 1973, three [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] prisoners escaped in the [[1973 Mountjoy Prison helicopter escape|Mountjoy Prison helicopter escape]], when a hijacked helicopter landed in the exercise yard at [[Mountjoy Prison]], [[Dublin]], [[Republic of Ireland]]. *In 1975, 28-year-old American convicted [[drug smuggler]] [[Billy Hayes (writer)|Billy Hayes]] escaped from a prison in [[İmralı]], [[Turkey]], using a rowboat. He made his way to [[Istanbul]], then to Greece, where he was eventually deported to the U.S. Hayes wrote a book on his experiences, ''[[Midnight Express (book)|Midnight Express]]'', which was later adapted into the 1978 film ''[[Midnight Express (film)|of the same name]]'' starring [[Brad Davis (actor)|Brad Davis]] as Hayes.
===1975–1999=== *On 5 April 1976, in the [[Segovia prison break]], twenty nine prisoners escape from prison, in Spain's largest prison break since the country's [[Spanish civil war|civil war]]. The majority belong to the [[Basque nationalism|Basque]] [[separatism|separatist]] group [[ETA (separatist group)|ETA]]. The majority of prisoners are recaptured in shoot outs with the authorities in the next few days, during which one escapee is killed, though four manage to escape to France. *In 1977, the convicted murderer of [[Martin Luther King, Jr.]], [[James Earl Ray]], escaped from Brushy Mountain State Prison in Tennessee, along with six others. Ray was recaptured after two days. He had been running and hiding in the mountainous forest surrounding the prison. *In 1977, convicted murderer James Robert Jones escaped from prison in Kansas, and lived in Florida for 37 years under the alias of Bruce Walter Keith. He was arrested in March 2014. It is assumed that he used someone else's identity.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=11222409 |title=Murderer caught after 37 years on run - World - NZ Herald News |publisher=Nzherald.co.nz |date=2014-03-19 |accessdate=2014-05-15}}</ref> *In 1979, [[Assata Shakur]] successfully escaped prison in Union, New Jersey when three members of the Black Liberation Army took prison guards as hostages, freed Assata and fled in a prison van. No one was injured during the prison break, including the guards-turned-hostages who were left in the parking lot. In 1984, Shakur escaped to Cuba where she gained political asylum. Shakur was moved to the FBI's Most Wanted Terrorists List on May 2, 2013. * On 2 March 1982 in [[Peru]], [[Shining Path|PCP]] guerilla fighters [[Assault of Ayacucho prison|assaulted the Ayacucho prison]], resulting in the release of 255 inmates. * In the [[1983 Batticaloa Jailbreak]] on 23 September 1983, 41 [[Tamil people|Tamil]] political prisoners and 151 criminal prisoners escaped in eastern [[Sri Lanka]]. * In the [[Maze Prison escape]] on 25 September 1983, 38 [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] members escaped from [[HMP Maze]] in [[Northern Ireland]], the biggest prison escape in Irish or British history. * In 1984, six death row inmates escaped [[Mecklenburg Correctional Center]], making it the largest mass death row escape in American history. All were recaptured within 18 days, and all six men would eventually be executed. The final execution took place in 1996. * On 7 March 1993, [[Peter Gibb]] and Archie Butterley escaped from the [[HM Melbourne Assessment Prison|Melbourne Remand Centre]] in Australia, with the help of prison guard Heather Parker who was having a relationship with Gibb. Police found Butterley shot dead six days later, and re-captured Gibb. * [[Trikala]], [[Greece]], on May 23, 1995, Albanian inmates staged a daring escape from an old Turkish administration building-turned-prison, using weight dumbbells to break the locks of the gates and bed springs as a ladder to scale the wall. 29 prisoners escaped, and about half of them absconded to [[Albania]] and were never recaptured. Only Albanian inmates escaped, having kept escape plans secret from the prison's international population. * In the [[1995 Vellore Fort Jailbreak]] on 15 August 1995, 43 [[Tamil Tigers|Tamil Tiger]] inmates escaped from [[Vellore Fort]] prison in India. * In 1998, the Belgian child molester [[Marc Dutroux]] notoriously managed to escape for a few hours. He was caught the same afternoon, but the incident forced two politicians to resign and deepened the loss of faith in the Belgian judicial system.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/88889.stm|title=BBC News - EUROPE - Dutroux re-enacts escape|publisher=}}</ref> * Martin Gurule escaped from the Texas Death Row at [[Ellis Unit]] in 1998. He was found dead a few days later.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=PIVIAAAAIBAJ&sjid=1m8DAAAAIBAJ&pg=6786%2C1664984 | title=Inmate found dead near breakout site | work=Pittsburgh Post-Gazette | date=Dec 4, 1998 | accessdate=14 May 2015 | author=Graczyk, Michael | pages=A13}}</ref> * In 1999, [[Leslie Dale Martin]] and three other inmates on [[Louisiana]]'s [[death row]] escaped from their cells at the [[Louisiana State Penitentiary]]. They were caught within hours, before they even managed to escape prison grounds. The four men had managed the escape with the use of [[hacksaws]] that had been smuggled in for them by a bribed corrections officer. Other officers were inattentive to the inmates' two to three week effort at cutting their cell doors and window. After the escape, two corrections officers were fired and two others were demoted. Two corrections officers later overheard Martin plotting another escape, which included taking hostages and commandeering a vehicle to ram the prison's front gates. Martin was immediately moved to the holding cell outside the [[death chamber]], a month before his [[execution]] in 2002.
===2000–present===
* The [[Texas Seven|Texas 7]] escaped from [[John B. Connally Unit]] on December 13, 2000. Six of them were captured after over a month and a half on the run; the seventh killed himself before being captured. * In January 2001, three inmates escaped from [[Chicago State Penitentiary]]'s H-Unit (Hi-Max). One of them was injured during the escape, and while trying to get back into the prison he got caught in the razor between the fences. The other two offenders (one serving a life sentence for murder, the other for rape and kidnapping) were at large for several days before being apprehended in a small town approximately {{convert|40|mi|km}} from the prison. * In New York, two convicted murderers escaped from Elmira State Penitentiary in July 2003; both were recaptured in two days. * [[Colton Harris-Moore]] fled a three-year sentence by walking out of a [[halfway house]] in April 2008. On 11 July 2010, he was captured at [[Harbour Island, Bahamas]] and sent back to [[Seattle]] * The [[Sarposa Prison attack]] was a raid on the [[Kandahar detention facility]] in [[Kandahar]], [[Afghanistan]] by [[Taliban]] insurgents on June 13, 2008. One of the largest attacks by Afghan insurgents, the raid freed 400-1000 prisoners. * On August 4, 2008, [[Sarah Jo Pender]] escaped from [[Rockville Correctional Facility]] with the help of prison guard Scott Spitler, who was expecting a $15,000 payment.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://caselaw.findlaw.com/in-court-of-appeals/1219359.html|title=FindLaw's Court of Appeals of Indiana case and opinions.|publisher=}}</ref> She remained on the run for four months. * Eight inmates charged with violent crimes [[Clovis, New Mexico jail break|escaped from the Curry County Adult Detention Center]] in [[Clovis, New Mexico|Clovis]], [[New Mexico]] on August 24, 2008. The men escaped by climbing prison pipes in a narrow space inside a wall, then using homemade instruments to cut a hole in the roof. The jailbreak was featured on a September 6 episode of ''[[America's Most Wanted]]''. As of October 2010, convicted murderer Edward Salas was the only inmate still at large. Salas was taken into custody by the U.S. Marshals Service on Thursday, October 4, 2012 in Chihuahua City, Mexico, and was extradited back to New Mexico.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newschannel10.com/story/19747509/fbis-most-wanted-captured |title=Convicted killer Edward Salas captured in Mexico|publisher=[[KFDA-TV]] |accessdate= 2012-10-15}}</ref> * Lance Battreal, Charles Smith, and Mark Booher escaped from a [[Michigan City, Indiana]] prison on July 12, 2009 through underground tunnels under the prison yard.<ref>[http://www.wishtv.com/dpp/news/crime/3_inmates_escape_Michigan_City_prison_20090712 "3 inmates escape Michigan City prison"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120303075204/http://www.wishtv.com/dpp/news/crime/3_inmates_escape_Michigan_City_prison_20090712 |date=2012-03-03 }} ''[[WISH-TV]]'' Retrieved on 2009-07-23</ref> Smith was captured on July 20, 2009 near Chicago Mayor [[Richard M. Daley]]'s vacation home in [[Grand Beach, Michigan|Grand Beach]], [[Michigan]].<ref>[http://www.thestarpress.com/article/20090714/NEWS01/907140306 "One Henry County killer caught near Chicago mayors home"]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ''[[The Star Press]]'' Retrieved on 2009-07-23</ref> Battreal was captured on July 21, 2009 at his mother's house in [[Rockport, Indiana]].<ref>[http://www.wivb.com/dpp/news/nation/midwest/nat_ap_rockport_2nd_of_3_indiana_prison_escapees_captured_20090721716_2663789 "2nd of 3 Ind. prison escapees captured"] ''[[WIVB]]'' Retrieved on 2009-07-23</ref> Booher was captured on July 23, 2009 in a hotel in [[Indianapolis]], [[Indiana]].<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2009/CRIME/07/23/indiana.prison.escape/ "Last of three prison escapees captured in Indiana"] ''[[CNN]]''</ref> *Three inmates at an [[Arizona State Prison - Kingman|Arizona State Prison]] for-profit [[Management and Training Corporation]]-operated facility escaped on July 30, 2010. Daniel Renwick and Tracy Province were murderers and John McCluskey had been convicted of attempted murders. Renwick was captured in a shootout in Rifle, Colorado on August 1, 2010. Though he still had 32 years on his sentence in Arizona, he was sentenced to 60 years to be served in Colorado. Province, already a lifer, was captured on August 9, 2010 in Meeteese, Wyoming.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Inmate Sentenced in Arizona Prison Escape|url=http://www.lvrj.com/news/first-inmate-charged-in-arizona-prison-escape-114812684.html|accessdate=31 July 2011}}</ref> After being sentenced to 38 1/3 years in Arizona, he was quickly extradited to face murder charges in New Mexico. McCluskey, who had been doing consecutive 15-year sentences, was captured with Casslyn Welch, his cousin/accomplice, in eastern Arizona on August 19 in the Apache-Sitgreaves National Forest. He was sentenced to 43 years in an Arizona prison on escape, kidnap, hijacking and robbery charges.<ref>{{cite web|title=Arizona inmate gets 43 years for his escape|url=http://www.lvrj.com/news/arizona-inmate-gets-43-years-in-prison-after-escape-124114574.html|accessdate=19 June 2011}}</ref> Like Province, Welch and McCluskey were soon extradited for the alleged robbery, hijack and murder of two vacationers in New Mexico. [[Kenneth John Gonzales]], the U.S. Attorney in New Mexico, filed death penalty charges against all three. McCluskey was convicted after a three-month trial in Albuquerque on October 7, 2013, after Province and Welch testified against him, a conditions of their plea bargains. The death penalty phase of the proceedings began on October 21,<ref>[https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/10/07/arizona-inmate-murder/2939801 "Inmate convicted of killing retired couple while on the lam"], [[U.S.A. Today]], 7 October 2013. Retrieved 16 October 2013</ref> but the jury delivered a sentence of life imprisonment for McCluskey, and Province received the same. Welch was sentenced to 40 years.<ref>[http://www.abqjournal.com/409968/news/40-years-for-womans-role-in-murders.html "40 Years for Woman's Role in Murders"], [[Albuquerque Journal]], Scott Sandlin. June 2, 2014. Retrieved 25 February 2016.</ref> * On July 27, 2013, 1,000 inmates escaped from the Queyfiya prison near [[Benghazi]], [[Libya]]. The escape occurred after a wave of political assassinations and attacks on political offices around the country. Local residents of Benghazi forced the inmates out of the prison. * In October 2013, Kevin Patrick Stoeser escaped from the Austin Transitional Center where he was serving the remainder of a 156-month sentence for four counts of child sexual assault and one count of possession of child pornography. He pleaded guilty to these charges in 2003. He was never captured but DNA-confirmed remains of his skull were found near Del Valle, Texas on September 8, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usmarshals.gov/investigations/most_wanted/stoeser/stoeser-111714.htm|title=U.S. Marshals 15 Most Wanted Fugitive’s Skull Found by Family Dog|publisher=}}</ref> *On June 8, 2014, Robert Elbryan, 42, Joe Game, 53, and George Broussard, 63, escaped from a Quebec detention center with help from a helicopter. The three men were arrested a couple weeks later and returned to the same facility.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/06/22/world/americas/canada-helicopter-jailbreak/index.html|title=Escapees in Canadian helicopter jailbreak captured - CNN.com|first=By Michael Pearson|last=CNN|publisher=}}</ref> *On September 11, 2014, TJ Lane, 19, serving three life sentences for [[Chardon High School shooting|indiscriminately killing fellow students at his Ohio high school in 2012]], and Jay Morris, 20, escaped [[Allen Correctional Institution]]. Rodriguez was apprehended about 5 hours later, and Morris was captured about 8 hours later.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/09/11/justice/ohio-school-shooter-escapes/index.html|title=Convicted killer T.J. Lane captured after escape - CNN.com|first=By Ed Payne and Cristy Lenz|last=CNN|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wkyc.com/story/news/local/northeast-ohio/2014/09/11/tj-lane-escape/15485863/|title=CAPTURED - Chardon shooter T.J. Lane in custody|first=|last=TEGNA|publisher=}}</ref> *On June 6, 2015, [[Richard Matt]], 48, and David Sweat, 34, were [[2015 Clinton Correctional Facility escape|discovered missing]] from the [[Clinton Correctional Facility]] in [[Dannemora (village), New York|Dannemora, New York]] during a head count at 5:30am. An "external breach" was found on a street approximately 500 feet south of the prison wall. Both inmates had been convicted of murder. Richard Matt was shot dead on June 26, 2015 near Lake Titus in Upstate New York. Two days later on June 28, 2015, David Sweat was captured just miles from the Canada–US border, shot twice before taken to a local hospital. *On July 11, 2015, Mexican drug lord [[Joaquín Guzmán|Joaquín Guzmán Loera]], also known as 'El Chapo', escaped from Federal Social Readaptation Center No.1, a maximum security prison. His escape involved an elaborate underground tunnel leading from the shower area in his cell stretching 1.5 km to a house construction site. The shower area in his cell was not detectable to the security cameras, creating a blind spot. The tunnel lay 10 meters underground and was equipped with a ladder to climb to the bottom, artificial lights, air ducts and various construction materials. A makeshift motorcycle was found in the tunnel, believed to have been used to excavate the tons of earth removed, transport materials and Guzmán himself. An investigation and manhunt quickly followed. He was recaptured on January 8, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/CNNMex/status/685527281587097601|title=CNN México on Twitter|work=Twitter|accessdate=8 January 2016}}</ref> *On January 22, 2016, three inmates escaped the [[Orange County Sheriff's Department (California)#Jails|Orange County Men's Central Jail]], a maximum security jail in [[Orange County, California]]. The three inmates (Jonathan Tieu, 20; Hossein Nayeri, 37; and Bac Tien Duong, 43) cut through steel bars, made their way through plumbing tunnels, and a used a makeshift rope made out of bed sheets to rappel down the multistory facility.<ref>{{Cite web|title = California jail escape: 3 inmates on the loose - CNN.com|url = http://www.cnn.com/2016/01/24/us/california-escaped-inmates/index.html|website = CNN|access-date = 2016-01-30}}</ref> Bac Tien Duong surrendered to police in Santa Ana CA on January 29. The other two inmates, Hossein Nayeri and Jonathan Tieu, were arrested in San Francisco on January 30. *On November 7, 2016, two inmates escaped HMP Pentonville in North London. The two inmates (Mathew Baker and James Whitlock) used diamond-tipped cutting equipment to break through cell bars before they scaled the perimeter wall. They left mannequins in their beds to fool the prison guards.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-37899401|title=Two Pentonville prisoners escape over perimeter wall|date=2016-11-07|newspaper=BBC News|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-11-07}}</ref> Two days later, Baker was found – with dyed hair and a fractured leg – hiding under a bed at his sister’s home. Whitlock was found at an address in Homerton, east London, after six days on the run.

{{infobox military conflict | conflict = Lowara Madi incident | partof = the [[Pakistan-United States skirmishes]] | image = AH-64 Apache.jpg | image_size = 200px | caption = An American AH-64 Apache helicopter, which was repelled during the incident | date = 21 September 2008 | place = [[Afghanistan-Pakistan border]] | result = Pakistani victory | combatant1 = {{USA}} | combatant2 = {{PAK}} | strength1 = 2 [[AH-64 Apache]]s | strength2 = Unknown number of Pakistani troops
12.7 mm [[heavy machine gun|heavy
machine gun]]s | casualties1 = None
Possible aircraft damage | casualties2 = None }} {{Campaignbox Pakistan–United States skirmishes}} On 21 September 2008 at 10 pm local time, in the [[Ghulam Khan]] district of [[North Waziristan]] Pakistani soldiers fired on two American helicopter gunships that entered Pakistani airspace with 12.7 mm [[heavy machine gun]]s. The helicopters stopped and hovered for a while, before returning over the border to Afghanistan without retaliation. It is unknown if any of the helicopters sustained any damage in this first incident.[http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5jqhY55584EVVKxIIbOeHrLWeoPvA Pakistani troops twice repel US choppers: officials] AFP, 23 September 2008[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7628890.stm Pakistan troops 'repel US raid'] -''BBC News'', 22 September 2008 Thirty minutes later, two gunships attempted to cross the border again at the same place. Pakistani regular and [[Frontier Corps]] troops fired warning shots into the air and away from the helicopters, causing the helicopters to turn back without attacking any targets in Pakistan.[http://www.expressindia.com/latest-news/Pak-troops-fire-at-US-helicopters-in-N-Waziristan/364409/ Pak troops fire at US helicopters in N Waziristan] – ''ExpressIndia.com'', 22 September 2008 ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:International incidents]] [[Category:Pakistan–United States military relations]]

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Lynne Patton |image = Lynne Patton 2016 RNC - cropped.jpg |office = Administrator of the [[United States Department of Housing and Urban Development]] for Region II |president = [[Donald Trump]] |term_start = July 5, 2017 |term_end = |predecessor = |successor = |birth_name = Lynne Martine Patton |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] |education = [[University of Miami]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])}}
[[Quinnipiac University]] }} '''Lynne Martine Patton''' (born 1973 or 1974){{Cite news|url=http://heavy.com/news/2016/07/lynne-patton-eric-donald-who-is-speaking-rnc-republican-national-convention-foundation-make-america-first-great-again-african-american-supporter-meet-day-3/|title=Lynne Patton: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know|last=Levine|first=Daniel S.|date=2016-07-20|work=Heavy.com|access-date=2017-06-19|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US|df=mdy-all}} is an American [[event planner]], who was designated in June 2017 by President [[Donald Trump]] to head Region II of the [[United States Department of Housing and Urban Development]], which oversees [[New York (state)|New York]] and [[New Jersey]].{{cite news |url=http://www.politico.com/tipsheets/playbook/2017/06/16/ny-daily-news-trumps-new-ny-hud-director-planned-eric-trumps-wedding-has-no-housing-experience-dems-drub-gop-at-baseball-game-a-record-24-959-tickets-sold-pence-hires-mcguirewoods-cullen-bday-bres-220870 |title=N.Y. DAILY NEWS: Trump's new NY HUD director planned Eric Trump's wedding, has no housing experience -- DEMS drub GOP at baseball game -- A RECORD 24,959 tickets sold -- PENCE hires McGuireWoods' Cullen -- B'DAY: Bres |first=Jake |last=Sherman |first2=Anna |last2=Palmer |first3=Daniel |last3=Lippman |work=Playbook |publisher=[[Politico]] |date=June 16, 2017 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170616161152/http://www.politico.com/tipsheets/playbook/2017/06/16/ny-daily-news-trumps-new-ny-hud-director-planned-eric-trumps-wedding-has-no-housing-experience-dems-drub-gop-at-baseball-game-a-record-24-959-tickets-sold-pence-hires-mcguirewoods-cullen-bday-bres-220870 |archive-date=June 16, 2017}} She previously worked as an event planner for the [[Trump family]], including planning the [[wedding]] of [[Eric Trump]],{{cite news |publisher=[[Vox Media]] |title=Report: Trump wants his son's wedding planner to oversee federal housing programs |date=June 16, 2017 |first=Dylan |last=Scott |url=https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2017/6/16/15816282/lynne-patton-trump-federal-housing-programs}} and helping to run the [[Eric Trump Foundation]].{{cite news |title=Some donations to Trump Foundation count as Trump's money, aide says |first=Jason |last=Noble |work=[[Des Moines Register]] |date=September 21, 2016 |quote=Lynne Patton, a senior assistant to three of Trump's adult children and the vice president of son Eric Trump's charitable foundation, told The Des Moines Register that some donations to the Donald J. Trump Foundation should be recognized as contributions from Trump himself because in some cases that money would have been paid to Trump directly.|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/news/politics/2016/09/21/some-donations-trump-foundation-count-trumps-money-aide-says/90784632/ |page=A8}} She was a speaker at the [[2016 Republican National Convention]].{{cite news |publisher=[[Vox Media]] |url=https://www.vox.com/2016/7/20/12244326/lynne-patton-trump-video-rnc-republican-convention-2016 |title=Watch Trump supporter Lynne Patton explain to the RNC that racism still exists |first=Dara |last=Lind |date=July 20, 2016 |quote=Lynne Patton, the vice president of the Eric Trump Foundation, wasn't the first person of color to speak at Donald Trump's Republican National Convention.}} == Early life== Patton grew up in New Haven, Connecticut.{{Cite news|url=http://www.courant.com/news/connecticut/hc-lynne-patton-convention-0721-20160720-story.html|title=Assistant: 'Trump Is Not A Racist': Connecticut At The Conventions|last=Keating|first=Christopher|date=July 21, 2016|work=[[Hartford Courant]]|access-date=June 18, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|page=A4|quote=Patton, whose family hails from New Haven, created an emotional video that told part of her life story and her deep feelings about the Trumps.}} Her father is epidemiologist Curtis L. Patton, who was a professor (now emeritus) at [[Yale University]].{{Cite web|url=http://ymm.yale.edu/autumn2006/people/faculty/52131/|title=Curtis Patton retires from research and international health > Faculty > Autumn 2006 {{!}} Yale Medicine|website=ymm.yale.edu|access-date=June 18, 2017}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.al.com/news/index.ssf/2016/07/2_with_alabama_ties_among_toni.html|title=2 with Alabama ties among tonight's speakers at Republican National Convention 2016|work=AL.com|access-date=June 18, 2017|language=en-US |quote=Patton, who works for Eric Trump's Foundation and as an executive assistant for the candidate's adult children, is the daughter of Curtis L. Patton, Ph.D., a Birmingham native who is now Professor Emeritus of Epidemiology (Microbial Diseases) at Yale University. In her current role, Patton assists with planning all fundraising events for the foundation and its partnership with St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital. |first=Leada |last=Gore}} Patton graduated from the [[University of Miami]] with a B.A. in [[English literature]].{{cite news|url=https://www.erictrumpfoundation.com/board-of-directors/lynne-m.-patton|title=Lynne M. Patton|access-date=June 16, 2017|publisher=[[Eric Trump Foundation]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116182100/https://www.erictrumpfoundation.com/board-of-directors/lynne-m.-patton|archivedate=November 11, 2016}} She attended the [[Quinnipiac University School of Law]]; school officials have stated that she was a student for only two semesters, and did not graduate.{{cite news |publisher=[[Law360]] |quote=A longtime associate of President Donald Trump's family, who reportedly has been tapped to lead federal housing programs in New York and New Jersey, touts attending Quinnipiac University School of Law on her LinkedIn page, but a university official said she only spent two semesters there and never graduated. |first=Bill |last=Wichert |title=Reported HUD Leader Not Grad Of Law School In Online Bio |date=June 16, 2017 |access-date=June 17, 2017 |url=https://www.law360.com/articles/935792/reported-hud-leader-not-grad-of-law-school-in-online-bio}}{{cite news |publisher=[[CNN]] |date=June 16, 2017 |title=Trump's former event planner could soon be in charge of federal housing programs in New York |first=Chris |last=Cillizza |url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/06/16/politics/lynne-patton-wedding-trump/index.html}} On her [[LinkedIn]] page, Patton also claims affiliation with [[Yale University]], which she did not attend.{{cite news |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/trump-chooses-family-event-planner-run-n-y-housing-programs-article-1.3251314?cid=bitly|title=President Trump chooses inexperienced woman who planned his son Eric's wedding to run N.Y. federal housing programs|first=Greg|last=Smith |work=[[New York Daily News]] |date=June 16, 2017 |accessdate=January 25, 2018}}[https://www.linkedin.com/in/lynnepatton Lynne M. Patton] via [[LinkedIn]]. Accessed June 16, 2017.{{cite news |url=http://www.politico.com/story/2017/06/26/lynne-patton-trump-party-planner-new-york-federal-housing-239963 |publisher=''[[Politico]]'' |date=June 26, 2017 |title=Trump party planner promoted at HUD after Carson's troubled tour |first=Lorraine |last=Woellert |quote=Her LinkedIn page cites Quinnipiac University School of Law, which she attended briefly, and Yale, which she didn't attend at all.}} ==Career== An Eric Trump Foundation staff biography of Patton states that she was involved in casting the 2012 and 2014 seasons of ''[[The Celebrity Apprentice]]''.{{cite news|last1=Kirkland|first1=Allegra|title=Trump's Onetime Rivals Resurface For RNC's 'Make America First Again' Night|url=http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/speakers-convention-make-america-first-again-night|work=[[Talking Points Memo]]|accessdate=November 16, 2017|date=July 20, 2016|quote=played a key role in casting the 2012 and 2014 seasons of "The Celebrity Apprentice."}} Patton was one of 16 unpaid directors at the [[Eric Trump Foundation]], though her position did not appear in the Foundation's 2014 tax filings.{{cite news |agency=[[The Associated Press]] |quote=Patton is Eric Trump's longtime personal assistant. After the AP questioned the campaign's citation of her as a Trump Organization executive, her title on the Eric Trump Foundation's website and her profile on the LinkedIn service was changed to "vice president of the Eric Trump Foundation." That position did not appear on the foundation's most recent tax filing for 2014, which said Patton was one of 16 unpaid directors who devote approximately one hour per week to the charity. |title=Few if any minority senior execs in Trump's empire |first=Jeff |last=Horwitz |first2=Jake |last2=Pearson |date=June 16, 2016 |url=https://apnews.com/426e763d7a38472d9c1df8b799725084/few-if-any-minority-senior-execs-trumps-empire}} Her HUD financial disclosures stated that she had been a vice president and a board member at the Eric Trump Foundation from January 2009 to January 2017, and she speaks of being with the Trump family since 2009.{{Cite journal|last=Trump|first=Donald J.|date=February 1, 2017|title=Remarks at an African American History Month Listening Session|url=|journal=Daily Compilation of Presidential Documents|publisher=Superintendent of Documents|volume=|page=5|pages=|issn=|via=}}{{Cite news|url=|title=10 Must Reads for the CRE Industry Today (June 14, 2017)|last=|first=|date=June 14, 2017|work=National Real Estate Investor|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|quote=Eric Trump Foundation Probe Casts Shadow Over HUD "The New York State Attorney General's investigation into possible misuse of funds at the Eric Trump Foundation is casting a shadow over the Department of Housing and Urban Development, where a former foundation vice president now works as a key adviser to Secretary Ben Carson. Before joining HUD in March, Lynne Patton was a vice president and board member at the Eric Trump Foundation between January 2009 and January 2017, according to her public financial disclosure report."}}{{Cite news|url=|title=On The Record|last=|first=|date=September 2, 2016|work=Fox News|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|quote=Vice president of the Eric Trump Foundation and family ambassador of minority engagement for the Trump campaign, Lynne Patton is here to go ON THE RECORD.....You know, I have been working with the Trump family for seven years. I know Mr. Trump. I know his heart and I know his passion for this country to be true. I am with this family each and every day.}} In May 2016, during Donald Trump's 2016 Presidential campaign, Patton narrated a [[YouTube]] video called "The Trump Family I Know – A Black Female Trump Executive Speaks Out," in which she defended Trump against accusations that he was racist. She spoke at the 2016 Republican National Convention; the official convention program listed her position as "Vice President of The Eric Trump Foundation and Senior Assistant to Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, and Donald Trump, Jr."{{Cite news|url=|title=2016 GOP Convention Program for Wednesday, July 20|last=|first=|date=July 20, 2016|work=U.S. Newswire|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|quote=Lynne Patton, The Eric Trump Foundation Lynne Patton is Vice President of The Eric Trump Foundation and Senior Assistant to Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, and Donald Trump, Jr. As VP, Lynne works in tandem with the Executive Director/President of the Foundation to oversee all operations, volunteers, events, outreach, social media, vendors, and corporate partnerships. She assists with the planning of all major fundraising events for the Foundation. She also works to identify and develop viable partnerships and research projects for the Foundation in conjunction with St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.}} In her convention speech, she acknowledged historical racism, but said that Donald Trump knows that black lives, LGBTQ lives, veterans' lives, and police lives matter.{{Cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/1607/20/se.03.html|title=CNN.com - Transcripts|last=|first=|date=July 20, 2016|website=www.cnn.com|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=June 18, 2017|quote=Sadly though, there is not one person in this room who can deny that historically black lives have mattered less. My life mattered less. And whether we like it or not, there are people out there who still believe this to be true. But tonight, as a minority myself, I personally pledge to you that Donald Trump knows that your life matters. He knows that my life matters. He knows the LGBTQ lives matter. He knows that veterans lives matter. And he knows that blue lives matter.}} Later in the campaign, Patton joined other campaign spokeswomen on the Trump-Pence Women's Empowerment Tour.{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2016/09/the-trump-campaign-launched-a-womens-empowerment-tour.html|title=The Trump-Pence Women's Empowerment Tour Is Real|last=Spellings|first=Sarah|date=September 11, 2016|work=The Cut|access-date=June 18, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en|quote=Led by Lara Trump, the presidential nominee's daughter-in-law, the tour is rounded out by campaign spokeswoman Katrina Pierson, Lynne Patton, and YouTube stars Lynette Hardaway and Rochelle Richardson.}} She is a director of [[National Diversity Coalition for Trump]].{{cite web|title=Who We Are|url=http://ndctrump.com/who-we-are/|website=National Diversity Council for Trump|accessdate=November 16, 2017}} ===Trump Administration=== Beginning in January 2017, Patton served as a [[White House]] liaison and Director of Public Liaison for the [[United States Department of Housing and Urban Development]].{{cite news |url=http://thehill.com/homenews/house/338148-dem-tells-trump-to-remove-family-event-planner-as-head-of-ny-federal-housing |work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |title=Dem tells Trump to remove family event planner as head of NY federal housing |first=Cristina |last=Marcos |date=June 16, 2017 |quote=Trump initially placed Patton as a White House liaison at HUD in February.}}{{cite news |url=https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/DCPD-201700085/pdf/DCPD-201700085.pdf |quote=Department of Housing and Urban Development Director of Public Liaison Lynne Martine Patton. |title=Remarks at an African American History Month Listening Session |date=February 1, 2017 |publisher=[[United States Government Publishing Office]] |access-date=June 16, 2017 |page=1}}{{cite news |quote=Ms. Lynne Martine Patton, Department of Housing and Urban Development |title=Trump Convenes Black History Month 'Listening Session' With People Who Like Him |first=Igor |last=Bobic |work=[[The Huffington Post]] |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/trump-black-history-month_us_5891fef8e4b0522c7d3e3d79 |date=February 1, 2017 |access-date=June 16, 2017}} Since the Trump Organization co-owns some properties that receive federal rental subsidies from HUD, her position raised questions of conflict of interest.{{Cite news|url=|title=Rising Stars 2017: Administration Staffers: Lynne Patton|last=Miller|first=Jonathan|date=April 20, 2017|work=CQ Roll Call|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}} Beginning in July 5, 2017, Patton is to head Region II.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/16/us/politics/trump-family-wedding-planner-to-head-new-yorks-federal-housing-office.html |work=[[The New York Times]] |title=Trump Family Wedding Planner to Head New York's Federal Housing Office |first=Yamiche |last=Alcindor |first2=J. David |last2=Goodman |date=June 16, 2017 |access-date=June 16, 2017}} She has no reported experience with [[housing policy]]. Congressional Representatives [[Grace Meng]] and [[Nydia Velázquez]], both Democrats from New York, publicly urged the administration to reconsider the appointment.{{Cite news |quote="This appointment is a slap in the face to New Yorkers, NYCHA residents and all Americans who rely on well administered HUD programs to have livable housing and safe communities. By all accounts Ms. Patton is fundamentally unqualified for this position. I strongly urge the Administration to revisit this decision, which appears on its face to be shameful patronage at the expense of working families." |url=https://velazquez.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/velazquez-patton-appointment-lead-hud-region-ii|title=Velazquez on Patton Appointment to Lead HUD Region II|date=June 16, 2017|work=Congresswoman Nydia Velazquez|access-date=June 18, 2017|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://meng.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/meng-sends-letter-to-president-trump-asking-he-remove-extremely|title=Meng Sends Letter to President Trump Asking He Remove Extremely Unqualified HUD Appointment Lynne Patton|date=June 16, 2017|work=Congresswoman Grace Meng|access-date=June 18, 2017|language=en}} In January 2018, Patton called [[April Ryan]], the White House correspondent and Washington bureau chief for [[American Urban Radio Networks]], "Miss Piggy".{{Cite news|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/lynne-patton-april-ryan_us_5a6950e8e4b0022830094106|title=Trump HUD Official Lynne Patton Under Fire After Calling Journalist 'Miss Piggy'|last=Mazza|first=Ed|date=January 25, 2018|work=Huffington Post|access-date=January 25, 2018|language=en-US}} Patton later apologized. In September 2018, Patton mocked sexual allegations against Supreme Court justice nominee Brett Kavanaugh. That same month, she also falsely claimed that CNN host Anderson Cooper had faked a live shot.{{Cite news |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/09/18/politics/kfile-patton/index.html |title=Senior HUD official Lynne Patton attempts to clarify controversial social posts |last=Kacyznski |first=Andrew |work=CNN |access-date=September 21, 2018 |date=September 18, 2018 |author-link=Andrew Kaczynski}} ==Personal life== Patton says she has struggled with substance abuse and addiction, and publicly praised the Trump family for standing by her through tough times.{{cite news|last1=Woellert|first1=Lorraine|title=Trump party planner promoted at HUD after Carson's troubled tour|url=http://www.politico.com/story/2017/06/26/lynne-patton-trump-party-planner-new-york-federal-housing-239963|accessdate=June 27, 2017|work=[[Politico]]|date=June 26, 2017|quote=Patton has been public about struggles with substance abuse and addiction}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Patton, Lynne}} [[Category:United States Department of Housing and Urban Development officials]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:University of Miami alumni]] [[Category:Quinnipiac University alumni]] [[Category:Trump administration personnel]] [[Category:New York (state) Republicans]] [[Category:Event planners]] [[Category:Year of birth uncertain]]

{{Infobox person | name = Maxine Lewis | image = Maxine_Lewis_-_Producer,_Talent_Scout.jpg | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = Harlem, New York City, New York | birth_place = | residence = Bronx, New York | nationality = United States | education = | occupation = Entertainment Producer | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Maxine Lewis''' is a producer, talent scout, and event planner for Harlem's Amateur Night (Showtime at the Apollo). She was [[Percy Sutton]]'s spokeswoman.<ref name="nydailynews">{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/archives/money/showdown-apollo-african-heritage-network-city-tv-rights-article-1.786714|publisher=nydailynews.com|title=SHOWDOWN AT THE APOLLO AFRICAN HERITAGE NETWORK VS. INNER CITY FOR TV RIGHTS - NY Daily News|accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> <ref name="dailypress">{{cite web|url=http://articles.dailypress.com/2001-10-13/news/0110130243_1_apollo-cherry-audition|publisher=articles.dailypress.com|title=Yard Worker To Appear On 'Apollo' - tribunedigital-dailypress|accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> Percy Sutton was a Harlem leader and co-founder of the [[Inner City Broadcasting Corporation]]. The Inner City group was founded in 1970. It was founded by a group of prominent African-American New Yorkers, such as [[Clarence Benjamin Jones]], [[Hal Jackson]], [[Carl McCall]], [[Wilbert Tatum]], [[David Dinkins]], [[Betty Shabazz]], and other shareholders that were active in business, community civic involvements and development. Percy Sutton was a long term Manhattan Borough president and was a high-ranking black elected official in New York City. He was a civil rights lawyer, an entrepreneur and freedom rider.<ref name="dnainfo">{{cite web|url=https://www.dnainfo.com/new-york/20091228/manhattan/percy-sutton-dies-leaving-harlem-city-mourning|publisher=dnainfo.com|title=Percy Sutton Dies, Leaving Harlem and the City in Mourning - Manhattan - DNAinfo New York|accessdate=2017-03-03|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170304040320/https://www.dnainfo.com/new-york/20091228/manhattan/percy-sutton-dies-leaving-harlem-city-mourning|archivedate=2017-03-04|df=}}</ref> The Inner City Broadcasting Corporation bought WLIB-AM, one of the city's first African American owned radio stations. Maxine Lewis starting working for Percy Sutton in the early 80s. Sutton produced It's Showtime at the Apollo, a syndicated, music television show first broadcast on September 12, 1987.
She has worked for the Apollo theatre for decades as a producer for [[Showtime at the Apollo]], and Apollo Kids at the [[Apollo Theater]] in Harlem.<ref name="baltimoresun">{{cite web|url=http://articles.baltimoresun.com/1998-08-21/features/1998233101_1_apollo-kids-sing-loud-harlem-theater|publisher=articles.baltimoresun.com|title=Tiara Shahid | 'Showtime at the Apollo' begins here Talent: Children audition at Reisterstown Road Plaza for a chance to appear at the famed Harlem theater. - tribunedigital-baltimoresun|accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> She has been an organizer for over 21 years for the 154/153 streets' Extended Family Reunion in Harlem, an event that brings residents from the neighborhood and residents that used to live in the area in July of each year. <ref name="ny">{{cite web|url=https://aging.ny.gov/SeniorCitizensDay/2015Honorees/Bronx.cfm|publisher=aging.ny.gov|title=NYSOFA - News - Senior Citizens Day 2015 - Bronx County|accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref>
==Early life== She was born and raised in [[Harlem]], [[New York City]].
==Career== Maxine Lewis is a Special Events Producer for Diamonds in the Rough Independent Entertainment from 1986 to till the present (31 years).
[[Percy Sutton]] was the founder of Inner City Broadcasting Corporation. Which bought the Apollo Theatre in 1981. They rescued the Apollo Theatre from bankruptcy Court. The theatre was refurbished. She served as Percy Sutton's Executive Assistant for 19 years.
In 1992, Maxine organized and produced a memorial tribute for tap dancer [[Charles Coles]] known as Charles "Honi" Coles at the Apollo Theatre. She began working for Inner City Broadcasting Corporation in 1982. In 1984 she became the talent coordinator for amateur segments for Showtime at the Apollo and later segment producer for "Apollo Kids" segments for over 14 years. She traveled across the country looking for talent to be showcased.<ref name="dailypress2">{{cite web|url=http://articles.dailypress.com/1997-10-23/features/9710220201_1_gee-puff-daddy-amateur-night|publisher=articles.dailypress.com|title=Showtime At The Apollo - tribunedigital-dailypress|accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> Some well known artists that she showcased were: [[Lyfe Jennings]], [[Jermaine Paul]], [[Ne-Yo]], [[Jazmine Sullivan]], [[Lauryn Hill|Lauren Hill]], [[Canton Jones]], [[Jessica Care Moore]], and more. She has a featured segment on 90.3 WHCR FM radio for Street Corner Resources giving information and updates about resources and activities for adults.<ref name="ny">{{cite web|url=https://aging.ny.gov/SeniorCitizensDay/2015Honorees/Bronx.cfm|publisher=aging.ny.gov|title=NYSOFA - News - Senior Citizens Day 2015 - Bronx County|accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref> She has been a community volunteer serving food for years for Thanksgiving and Christmas at the [[National Action Network]] in Harlem. She is a member of Perfecting Faith Church in Freeport, Long Island, where she utilizes her skills for community service in special events organizing and public relations work.
==Awards== 2015 - Senior Citizen's Day by the New York State Office for the Aging for her community work honored for Community Service.
2015 - Senator Díaz of the Bronx, New York City presents a Senior Citizen of the Year proclamation to Maxine Lewis <ref name="nysenate">{{cite web|url=https://www.nysenate.gov/newsroom/articles/ruben-diaz/senator-d%C3%ADaz-presents-proclamation-honoring-mrs-maxine-lewis-senior|publisher=nysenate.gov|title=Senator Díaz presents a proclamation honoring Mrs. Maxine Lewis as Senior Citizen of the Year, along with Lt. Governor Kathy Hochul, Tuesday, May 5, 2015, Albany, NY | NY State Senate|accessdate=2017-03-03}}</ref>

[[Audiovisual|Audio Visual Hire and Installation]]{{cite web |url=http://www.incentivetravel.co.uk/news/venuesevents/22615-variety-hosts-an-evening-of-magic-at-vinopolis |title=Variety hosts an evening of magic at Vinopolis |date=6 October 2014 |access-date=27 August 2018 |work=Incentive Travel & Corporate Meetings}} | num_employees = 90+ (2016) | parent = [http://www.wpp.com wpp plc][[WPP plc|WPP Wiki]] | homepage = [http://www.metrobroadcast.com metrobroadcast.com] | footnotes = }} '''Metro Broadcast''' Ltd. is a UK-based [[Event management|corporate event]] supplier with its Head Office in London and a satellite operation in Scotland with offices in Edinburgh, Glasgow and Aberdeen. The company is a wholly owned subsidiary of [[WPP plc]].{{cite web |url=http://www.wpp.com/wpp/companies/metro/ |first=Mary |last=Metcalfe |title=Metro |access-date=27 August 2018 |work=[[WPP plc]] |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20180218060757/http://www.wpp.com:80/wpp/companies/metro/ |archive-date=18 February 2016}} Metro Broadcast is also the resident technical production supplier at several London event venues such as [[30 Euston Square]], a conference venue based at [[Royal College of General Practitioners|The Royal College of General Practitioners]], and one of Europe’s largest conference hotels, [[Hilton London Metropole]]. Metro’s production team also manages the https://www.youtube.com/yt/space/london/. Additionally, the company is a preferred event supplier at some of London’s most precious and historic buildings including [[Somerset House]], [[Natural history museum|the Natural History Museum]], [[Spencer House, London|Spencer House]], [[Worshipful Company of Barbers#Barber-Surgeons.27 Hall and Arms|Barber-Surgeons’ Hall]] and [[Middle Temple|Middle Temple Hall]]. ==History== In 1980, in a flat in [[Welling]], South East London, David Pacy,http://www.investegate.co.uk/article.aspx?id=20080325125433W2407 Managing Director and Brian Rottger, Technical Director founded Metrovideo. Its principal activity was tape sales to advertising agencies such as [[J. Walter Thompson|JWT]] (formerly J. Walter Thompson Co.), [[Saatchi & Saatchi]] and [[Young & Rubicam|Y&R]] (formerly Young & Rubicam). The company soon relocated to Landsdown Road in Stockwell and then, in April 1984, to the Old Bacon Factory in Great Suffolk Street,http://www.thetimenow.com/united_kingdom/london/audio_visual_services-92/metrovideo_ltd-1492781 London SE1. In early 1986, the business was sold to WPP plc, a British, multinational advertising and public relations company founded by [[Sir Martin Sorrell|Martin Sorrell]]. Metrovideo was the third company to be acquired by the Group. Metrovideo later acquired a number of regional video businesses for itself including Horizon Video and Still Frame Video in the South of England and Teletape Anglia in [[Cambridge]]. This expanded the sales, installation, service, AV hire and technical event productionhttp://www.incentivetravel.co.uk/news/venuesevents/22615-variety-hosts-an-evening-of-magic-at-vinopolis| areas of the company. A broadcast division of the company was located in offices in London’s [[Soho]].http://www.broadcastnow.co.uk/metro-to-expand-broadcast-arm/164686.article All of these businesses traded under the Metro Group banner. In 1990, Metro launched a full-service production business called G Force which later changed its name to Clever Media. Clever Media was then merged into another WPP operating company. In 1997, the company extended its operation into [[Scotland]] by establishing an office and equipment warehouse in [[Edinburgh]]. In 2007 the Company was renamed as Metro Broadcast Ltd. In 2012 Metro Broadcast relocated its head office and main business premises to its current location in Oval, South London. In 2014 it acquired additional workshop space to house its set and staging department. Today, the London business is led by Managing Director Mary Metcalfehttp://www.citmagazine.com/article/1294808/metro-broadcast-appoints-new-creative-lead and the Scottish business is led by Managing Director Oscar Askin.http://www.eventindustrynews.co.uk/brand-marketing/metro-ecosse-appointed-national-theatre-scotland-help-deliver-24-hour-live-streamed-event-theme-independence ==Services== [[Audiovisual|Audio visual hire]]http://www.incentivetravel.co.uk/news/venuesevents/22615-variety-hosts-an-evening-of-magic-at-vinopolis|
